Tuberculin skin test (TST).abnormal_range: Usually positive, but does not distinguish between latent and active infection

Interferon gamma release assay (IGRA).abnormal_range: Usually positive, but does not distinguish between latent and active infection

Mycobacterial culture.abnormal_range: Positive in gold standard diagnosis, but low yield and prolonged growth time

Xpert MTB/RIF assay.abnormal_range: Sensitivity varies depending on sample type (lymph node, gastric aspirate, ascitic fluid, fecal samples)

risk_factors: Ingestion of contaminated respiratory tract secretions
Hematogenous spread from active pulmonary infection
Contiguous spread from adjacent infected viscera or lymph nodes
Ingestion of contaminated unpasteurized dairy products (uncommon)

Chest X-ray.findings: Associated pulmonary disease in majority of cases

required: Positive mycobacterial culture (gold standard, but low yield)
supportive: Clinical presentation consistent with tuberculous enteritis
Abnormal findings on contrast studies of the gastrointestinal tract
Positive Xpert MTB/RIF assay (sensitivity varies by sample type)
